text: Bonnie Elizabeth Parker (October 1, 1910 – May 23, 1934) and Clyde Chestnut Barrow (March 24, 1909 – May 23, 1934) were American outlaws and robbers. They were from the area around Dallas. They traveled the Central United States with their gang during the Great Depression. Clyde is known today for his bank robberies. However, he preferred to rob small stores or rural gas stations. The gang is believed to have killed at least nine police officers and several civilians. The couple were eventually surprised and killed by police in Bienville Parish, Louisiana.Hinton, Ted and Larry Grove (1979). Ambush: The Real Story of Bonnie and Clyde. Austin, TX: Shoal Creek Publishers. . A 1967 movie about them, Bonnie and Clyde, stars Faye Dunaway and Warren Beatty. ==References== ==Other websites== * FBI files on Bonnie and Clyde, covering 1933-1944 * The Poems of Bonnie Parker * Unauthenticated Barrow letter to Henry Ford * The Clyde Barrow Gang collection from the Dallas Police Department Archives Category:American gangsters Category:American murderers Category:American robbers Category:Couples Category:Criminals from Texas Category:People from Dallas Category:People shot and killed by law enforcement officers in the United States
title: Bonnie and Clyde
